title: South Beach, Miami Beach
review_list:
This is the best beach in the United States. It is large and clean with fine sand. There are many life guard stations and police security.

A must see in South Floirda: the vibe, the craziness and the art deco. A bit of beach, a bit of history, shopping and all the vibes you may or may not wish for!

We had a few bumps in booking our hotel and car so we strolled around South Beach for a few hours, grabbing coffee at Starbucks and drinking it on the beach. Then we wandered the streets admiring all the retro architecture. It was far beyond expectation. Just so unique and a lot of different things to enjoy.

Will never go again. Was way overpriced. Service was horrible at every restaurant on Ocean Drive. Had to pay a 18% gratuity even though service was horrible.

I love South Beach!!! Favorite place to travel, always things to do and the food is amazing!!! Espanola Way is a great location to stay...great food, and hotels and walking distance to Ocean Dr!

I traveled recently to Miami , alone, and thought I would be dreadfully bored. However the walk on the beach and views from my suite at Hotel Victor were awesome. Did not miss having someone to take it in with at all.

We love everything about Sobe. However over our many trips here we have learned that February is the worst time to come. Weather is better than in nyc but unpredictable. In order to enjoy the beautiful beaches come another time. It's easy to get here and get acclimated. Something for everyone to do. Sexy sultry or chill and relaxed. We...

We biked along the bike path on a Tuesday and it was great, tried again on Sat and it was really crowded, but both times went about 4 miles down to South Pointe and back - a good workout!

Love the Art Deco facades of the houses, cafes, hotels and shops, but it has become too touristy. Although the beach is wonderful, you don't get peace and quite there either because the blaring of the music of the bars on Ocean Drive can be heard all the way to the edge of the beach, even with earbuds inserted.
Prices...

we were in south beach doing a tour of the historical buildings but couldn't miss the chance to dip our toes in the water. I had my nine year old daughter with me so I was a little concerned about the dress code on the beach. we went at 12:00 noon, saw nothing indecent. the water so beautiful, crystal clear,...

title: Miami Beach Boardwalk, Miami Beach
review_list:
We bike ride the whole board walk, fun to do good way to visit!
we were able to borrow bikes from our Hotel the Marriott FREE!

This has a great view of the ocean on one side and of the historic art deco hotels on the street side (Ocean Drive). It is also great for people watching.

A lovely place to wander and sit without dropping down onto the beach. Paved in places and decking in others. All seems accessible.

We love Miami Beach, and we use the boardwalk to work off some of our fine-dining calories. It's a beautiful place to go for a walk.

Loved walking and sightseeing the boutique hotels and restaurants. We walked and admired the beautiful beach at dusk and then strolled along and admired the unique hotels...parking was easy in a paid lot.

Wonderfull walk along the beach with lots of people watching. Connects to a paved walk that goes for miles. The actual board walk section does not allow bikes

We stayed close to the Miami Beach boardwalk for two nights and spent a lot of time there. We walked it, ran it, and even rented bikes. It is absolutely beautiful and alive. Lots of restaurants nearby and a gorgeous beach. What more could you want?

The boardwalk takes you for a few miles along the beach. You can rent a bike from Citi Bike, there are dozens of renting points. A great program for a sunny morning or afternoon.

Every morning with my wife it was our pleasure to walk on the way and seeing the sunrise . Very good path , beatiful view, green and clean .

This walk has a great view of properties and the beach. Safely see all of Miami Beach in a calm stroll.

title: Lincoln Road, Miami Beach
review_list:
The stores and shops keep the whole family busy, and the food choices never seem to end. I wish I lived down there just to try all the different stuff this one street has to offer.

Shopping, dining, movie theatre, make-up, coffee, spas - everything can be done on Lincoln Road! Go when you're ready to spend a day people watching. Also, the Farmer's Markets (when in season) on Saturdays are great.

Tourist trap, 1 or 2 good restaurants/snacks, like PAUL....
TERRIBLE TOURIST TRAP , disgusting MAGASINS, like the S I M O N ' S Sportswear..........They encourage you to leave /even encourage you to do so / your pair of shoes, and then DO NOT EXCHANGE THEM in case of selling a «wrong number»!!!! JUST DISGUSTING .....worse then 3rd world EXCROQUERIE!!!!

I would recommend a visit to Lincoln Road, but be aware of the parking at the modern parking on Lincoln Road 1111 in the corner with Alton Road. On weekends they have a flat rate of $30 that is nowhere to be seen when you drive in and that they charge people like me. When I went to pay parking...


More  



Interesting ,happenning street with fun shops and good restaurants filled with good looking people. A great place to spend 3 or 4 hours

Shopping wad lots of fun, also great selection of restaurants, there were Starbucks everywhere, within walking distance from Ocean Drive....

Lots of bars and restaurants, Great place to kill a few hours and shop for Miami trinkets. Hookah bar, Tesla store, Love the outdoor vibe

Nice walking promenade, plenty of global brand stores. Many restaurants. Always lots of people passing by. The Apple Store is the main shopping hub.

A trip to Miami is not complete without a visit to the Lincoln Road mall. A four block strip of upscale shops and restaurants. There are also two Starbucks in this four block area, God forbid you have to walk more than 2 blocks for coffee. The mall is good for window shopping at least for me because the prices...


More  



Accidentally stumbled upon Lincoln Road mall as we wandered away from the waterfront to continue exploring the area. This is a really nice outdoor mall. It was enjoyable to just walk along, unwinding, and visiting shops that caught our gaze (such as Dylan's Candy Bar - great selection!). Would definitely recommend a visit whilst you're in the Miami Beach neighbourhood.

title: South Pointe Park, Miami Beach
review_list:
South Pointe Park is at the southernmost end of the beach in South Beach. For those who enjoy a pleasant stroll or sitting in the ocean breeze and watching the surfers near the jetty, the fishermen on the pier, or the boats arriving and departing, this is a good spot. Not a must-see destination by any means, but if you...


More  



This is a park at the very end of South Beach. With its dunes and lush vegetation, it feels less like city and more like a wild piece of nature. A long pier at the end makes for a great stroll. We are local, and a bike trip from our condo on the west side, up the beachfront sidewalk and...


More  



South Pointe Park is at the most southern end of South beach, so you will probably pass this area if you walk the length of the beach. Nothing outstanding to see, but nice place to relax and chill on the grass, throw a ball or Frisbee.

The city has taken a forgotten space that wraps around Government Cut (Miami and its cruise ships waterway to the ocean), an ocean jetty, the beach and the ocean, planted it with grass and trees, built an enchanting playground and a canopied overlook. Voila ,a new park that EVERYONE in town and from out of town loves!

Small park at the most southern tip of Miami Beach. Not much to do really but it was a nice short walk to the pier where you get a grand sweeping view of the beach. There's no hotels or pubs near here so the beach is super family friendly. Good first point to visit to get the lay of the...


More  



We enjoy walking the South Pointe area. Nice wide walking path and a long pier. Great place to watch the cruise ships as they leave up close.

A gorgeous place to walk or run in the early morning or evening. The view is breathtaking and be sure to stop by Monty's for a drink or dinner

After our walk from North beach we wanted to reach the furthers point of Miami beach. We walked on the jetty and watched the world go by for some time. The security guards by the entrance to the jetty were great as we needed some local info, which they did their best to help us.

Thoroughly enjoyed 2-3 hours walking along the water, photographing, dining at Smith & Wollensky, taking in the views !

This is a great park if you like quiet away from the crazy SoBe scene. It is a great place to watch ships pass by.

title: Art Deco Historic District, Miami Beach
review_list:
I loved the feel of south Miami beach, especially the retro Art Deco buildings. It has a very south of France and Italian Riviera feel. I imagine it must have been wonderful in its era!!!! So much seems to be under renovation right now. Also sad to see some great old Art Deco buildings standing derelict!

Wonderful collection of Art Deco buildings for 1920s to 30s, plenty of bars and restaurants in this colorful part of Miami that should not be missed. Parking in this area can be difficult but is well worth the effort

A MUST in MIAMI !!!
All sorts of wonderful creatures passinf by, Hotels and Restaurants, not to mention the quantity of fancy cars passing by at all times.....

This area is always active and ready to please anyone looking for a good time. I traveled to this area for my birthday and was not let down. It was super bowl weekend and every bar and restaurant was in the spirit. AWESOME hospitality.

This is a beautiful street to grab a bite, enjoy people watching, or simply enjoy a romantic stroll. The Art Deco building are stunning. And it's directly across from the beautiful beach!

If you appreciate architecture, particularly art deco, SoBe Miami is the place to go! Lots of great hotels, houses, large and small, some under renovation, many already restored, great colors!

Art Deceo District is a nice place to stay a couple of days to relax on the nice beach and have a lot of fun in the evening.

I had the good fortune of staying in this district for a week so I had time to take many walks and really see the neighbourhood. Concentrate on Ocean Drive if you only have a short time and then Collins street followed by Washington avenue, then the rest of the area.

Art Deco is my thing so South Beach is my Mecca.
I can spend hours wandering around the historic district in Miami. It's the one thing that keeps me returning to
Miami over again as its such a special place

There are so many art deco buildings and it is really an experience to visit them especially as they are all in one main street. It is well worth a walk albeit a slightly long one!

title: Holocaust Memorial, Miami Beach
review_list:
We didn't have much time, and it is a place that you should spend time there. It was a very moving and well thought out memorial.

Passing this memorial on the way from the airport to our hotel, it didn't seem like something we'd make a special trip to return to. A huge arm, reaching skyward. But we were glad that we did.
It was a very moving experience, and just passing by in a car gives you no idea of the powerful impact the memorial...


More  



It is hard not to be moved by this installation... as you move counterclockwise around the main statue you can read about the holocaust. The story is inscribed in stone. Names of victims are also represented. This is a masterpiece of art and history.

I wouldn't go out of your way to find this place. While the intention is obviously good, the memorial itself isn't as impressive or memorable as other similar ones.

Worth a visit. Amazing feature statue and when you go through the tunnel it was a thought provoking moment

This memorial will render you speechless and evoke deep emotion. Take your time. Absorb the silence and reflect on what was. Say a prayer and hope we never see dark days again.

We must never forget the Holocaust and this beautiful exhibit reminds many and educates most as to the horrors of what happens when world stands by and doesn't help their fellow man--sort of what is going on with present US administration now.

Young children not aware of history need to see this place, so that they become aware of the atrocities committed during war & thus they don't repeat history & work towards a more peaceful world !!

One of the best memorials we have ever experienced regarding the Holocaust. The bus driver did not know that it was a Memorial to the Holocaust until a fellow passenger told her it was the monument with the tall arm.

I've seen memorials all over the US and abroad, and this is the most moving, hauntingly beautiful memorial I've experienced. The artist did an amazing job personifying the atrocious acts committed to those subjected to the terrors of that time. The entire experience (because it's more than a simple statue) is more than worth the time it takes to walk...


More

address: Eighth Street and Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL
review_list:
Any time anywhere you will see something of interest. Whether it is the old Art Deco hotels to the interesting groups of people on the street. The one thing I do not like are the different restaurants hawking for clients. They all try to get you to frequent their establishment by handing menus as you walk the street.

Stayed at hotel on ocean drive. Hotel was very expensive for a mediocre room. Nothing special about this place. If I ever go to Miami again, I would stay a couple of blocks away. Service better, prices better.

Some very nice old style - art deco buildings.........loads of guys with caps turned the other way round with «golden» chains on the neck, total show off to impress ...and terraces/cafés with outragious PRICES,,,,,
Only for the POWERBALL winners,,,,,,,,,,,,,

We spend mos of our evenings at Ocean 10, which was fabulous. The music was great, and overall service was fabulous. The price of food was extremely high and misleading... drove down ocean drive on way thru to daytona ,, amazing sites ,, just like you see on tv,, would love to have stayed in miami,, but was only passing thru,, next year,,, i will stay...

Had an awesome time roaming the streets of Miami and ocean dr. Everyone is smiling and ready to please. The food is endless with a great variety. The shops are nice and fairly reasonable. This area is great for those traveling alone , as a couple and also family friendly.

We visited Ocean Drive two days and one evening. A great experience with good food, great architecture and an entertaining environment!

Loved the vibe at night along Ocean Ave. Lots of energy here and this is what Miami Beach is about. Eat dinner looking out onto the street and enjoy.

The Ocean Drive strip seems to have most of the restaurants and night scenes in South Miami Beach other than the Lincoln Road Mall. The many restaurants spill out over the side walk so you have to walk through them on that side of the street. The other side is parkland leading to broad sandy beaches.
If you walk the...

If you like fun rowdy areas you have to stroll down Ocean Ave. it reminds me a bit of Burbon Street in New Orleans except not as dirty.

title: Collins Avenue, Miami Beach
review_list:
Collins Avenue is the place to go. All the renowed Hotels are there,
Many restaurants and bars, great atmosphere day and night.

wow,,we drove through miami on way to daytona in a camaro convertible in sept .. its hot 105 degree f,,, it is just the most amazing experience,, the buildings ,,the cars .. everything is just too much to take in.. highly recommended,,

Lovely stretch of road. We started at a hotel on the 4800 block of Collins Avenue. Very clean and well maintained. Just triple your drive time. It takes 30 minutes to drive 5 miles from the 4800 block to Bal Harbor. It took us about the same time to drive to South Beach to do some sight seeing. It does...

Collins Ave is not as interesting of a walk as Ocean Drive or Lincoln. It does have its fair share of restaurants and shops however but nothing like Ocean or Lincoln. Construction in places makes for difficult walking. It ends on its north end by transitioning into the beach walk which does makes for good walking.

Collins Avenue, at least in South Beach, has a mix of small shops and restaurants. Really if you are walking the area you're better off taking Ocean Drive to the north end then cutting over to the Lincoln Road Mall.
Further up Collins through north beach looks like a steady string of condos and hotels. Even less to do in...


More  



A must on every Miami Trip! Next to the beach and close to Lincoln road. Big but calm street with nice hotels.

This avenue very busy during day time and as specially evening time. You must be very careful to cross the streets , even with green light for pedestrians. Local and visitor drivers think they are priority number one over the pedestrians. Also, to many homeless people during evening and night time.

great runtrack along the blue ocean- track is clear and broad- a lot of other sportive people- has lamps so even after dark you can easily find your track- cool seabreeze- easy does it

There are so many different aspects to Collins Ave, but this review focuses on the Miami Beach area. The great part about this portion of Collins is that it's a mix of new and old. You'll have tons of shops, restaurants, and hotels that have retained their Art Deco origins. On one side of Collins you'll have the Intercoastal Waterway...

Amazing! Fun! We stayed on Collins Avenue at Chesterfield Hotel and Suites, so many things within walking distance... Didn't use the car once. Great food and drinks, fun, high energy atmosphere ‼️Already planning g our next trip😀

title: Bal Harbor Beach, Miami Beach
address: Collins Ave, North of 96th St, Miami Beach, FL 33154
review_list:
Saks and Neiman's and other designer stores with upscale wares are the focus of a trip to Bal Harbor. Unless you are in one of the rooms or condos on the water across from the mall you probably won't be on the beach. Be aware that this is an expensive environment; lovely landscaping and expensive restaurants-not flip flops and a...


More  



Excellent Hotels like the St.Regis direct on the endless beach and luxury Shopping right across the street, just walkway steps away.

And that includes Hawaii. The beach is wide, white, clean and beautiful. The people watching is great. This is a great place to visit and if you can afford to stay here, it is even better.

Lovely designer shops, but you see them everywhere, so nothing different to look at. Its a people want to be noticed place, the restaurants overpriced, bad service, average food, but good to people watch at.

I just love this place . Very attentive waiter , very clean and verry good food . We will come back here.

Spent an evening there, dining with friends.
The stores are great,- nordstroms looked interesting, but being with husbands couldn't explore
We sat outside for dinner and managed to sneak past some of the designer stores while waiting for our meal to arrive

Good, clean beach...wade right into the water...plenty of room on the sand. Certainly a place to go again! Great views of the high rises up and down the beach for a couple of miles in both directions. Great shopping, and excellent eats are within a block of the beach. Not seeing the downside!

in the middle of a highly classy area, the mall is steps away, the beach is huge, the sand very clean and few people. great for joggers in the morning or at night of for family.

Luckily I have a friend which lets me stay in this area. The beach here is beautiful, Shopping, Restaurants, and Charter Fishing are all minutes away.

Bal Harbour and Surfside are beautiful beaches. Easy to get to if you have a car as there is easy parking on Collins Avenue. Surfside is a more relaxed area with cafes and restaurants and Bal Harbour has its luxurious shopping / cafes. The St Regis is a solid upscale hotel with a poolside cafe mainly frequented by New Yorkers...

review_list:
We found the Romero Britto gallery by accident, we were shown round as we really enjoyed his work. He also does pieces for cruise ships and I found gifts in the airport by him too.

Only Romeo Britto Gallery in the US. Great place to visit or purchase. I went and on a whim and left with a limited edition signed Britto print. The staff is very personal and friendly. The art is fantastic and the gallery has items for less than $20.00 to the thousands depending on your price point. I love the fact...


More  



No big deal unless you are a fan of this type of merchandise. The last thing I need is shelves in my home with all this.

Colorful with large unique canvases splashed with interesting and creative designs and daring you to bring them home, if only you could accommodate the colors and size, but it captures the spirit of South Beach, so a good, albeit not inexpensive, memento.

My wife paints as a hobby and she had a great time at the Britto Gallery. Mr. Eduardo Martinez served as a great host, taking us to the artists first workshop and going out of his way to show us the paintings that would satisfy us a possible customers. He also enlightened us with bits and pieces of Mr. Britto's...


More  



A beautiful gallery that is bigger on the inside than it looks on the outside. So many fun pieces you wish you could bring home but you would have to sell your home first in order to be able to afford them--the $180,000 Yoda painting is what comes to my mind in particular.
Great little shop in the back where...


More  



If you like bright colors and creativity, you will LOVE Britto Central! They have some of the best talented sales professionals who will guide you through the gallery and tell you the history behind each piece of art. They are very friendly and informative about everything in the gallery. Whether you are in the market to purchase a piece of...


More  



Fun colorful paintings, prints and sculpture. Reminds me of Peter Max. Great gallery to educate the young kids. A must to see while shopping on Lincoln Rd

I love Britto, but it's too expensive for me. This shop/museum was open to walk through and see all the brightly colored artwork. I didn't buy anything, but it was fun to look. Not sure Id' bring small children in here, since the pieces are so expensive.

title: Jewish Museum of Florida - FIU, Miami Beach
address: 301 Washington Ave., Florida International University, Miami Beach, FL 33139
review_list:
I enjoy taking a 2 hour tour of South beach Jewish history.
It also included information about South Beach architecture, food & good tips

I have a unique connection to this former synagogue as my grandfather's first cousin was once the rabbi.
They have a nice collection of artifacts and it is certainly worth a visit.

A great tour on a no beach day. We learned a lot about the settling of South Beach from this guided tour. Nice gift shop and helpful staff.

An extremely informative museum on the history of the Jewish population in Florida. I visited to see the Iraqi Jewish Heritage exhibit on loan from the National Archives until February 14, 2016. The exhibit was wonderful in showcasing the history of Jewish lives in Iraq before the mass exodus. The story of finding and preserving these artifacts in Iraq was...


More  



It's a nice part of cultural art history. They offer changing exhibits. They have a small cafe inside and a nice gift shop.
There's metered street parking out front. Be warned you will be going through a metal detector upon entering.

The highlight of this remarkable museum was the Iraqi collection of books, art, and manuscripts that had been rescued and restored following the overthrow of Saddam Hussein. The permanent exhibition of historical items from Florida's Jewish past was very well displayed and explained.

Really enjoyed the chronological boards depicting the Jewish history including that of Miami from conception and all the artifacts that went with it. The Jewish artifacts of Iraq exhibit was quite phenomenal as well. A must see when visiting SOBE.

If you are interested in the history of the Jewish community Miami, a visit here is a must. There is a wealth of information. Much of the museum consists of storyboards and pictures, so be prepared to do a lot of reading. Some reviewers have commented about having docents show them around. Unfortunately we did not enjoy such a tour,...


More  



I thoroughly enjoyed the museum and the walking tour. Informative and fun. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and shared photos of restaurants and businesses no longer in existence.

Lots of fun and interesting history. Sadly, the once-ubiquitous Jewish eating establishments have all but disappeared from South Beach. Regardless, the museum itself is a treasure and worth a visit.

title: Surfside Beach, Miami Beach
address: 94th St and Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33154
review_list:
Nice quiet beach--alternative to South Beach perhaps. Potential parking challenges but definitely no greater than South Beach.

Everything you want in a beach, wide, clean, flat, white sand, gently sloping surf and it is patrolled.
We love the beach and we love this beach!

Clean sandy beach, calm ocean warmed by the gulf stream. Family friendly town. What more is there? There aren't many life guard stations but there are helicopter patrols. There are many amenities on nearby Harding Avenue.

I went there on a rainy January day. There wasn't a lot of people ( as I understand from the locals, that is how it goes usually) . But the place is very clean and a lot of people there surf. So if you want to get away from south beach and its noise, this is the place to go

We don't really want anyone to know about the beach at Surfside. No crowds, a beautiful beach. The North Shore Open Park Space takes up the southern half of the area. There are lower rise condominiums and hotels (8-12 stories) to the north with houses and other spaces between them. This beach, less than 30 minutes north of South Beach,...


More  



Great quiet beach... perfect for anyone- families, couples or individuals. Best if you want to run... as there is a PERFECT stretch to run north and south.

so here you are not quite interested in being in South Beach but yet want to have access I recommend staying in Surfside beach , not only will you feel relaxed there are hidden treasures that only Surfside has to offer.

We went here several times, there are some shops and restaurants on Harding Ave, but when we went it was really very quiet, a bit to quiet.
Beach is great, parking is no problem, enough space. Definitely worth a visit when you want to escape for a few hours from the crowded Miami South Beach.

Clean, pass through the greenbelt to get there, a tropical paradise in the city. The city treasures its beaches.

white sand and warm water! not much for night life; very quiet and you need to rent a car to get to South Beach.

title: The Wolfsonian - Florida International University, Miami Beach
review_list:
Although not an art lover I am a fan of Art Deco. This museum brings together a whole range of items (posters, postcards, artwork, domestic and industrial objects) to draw together key themes developing in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Cleverly curated.

The Wolfsonian is housed in an art deco fortress originally built as a storage facility. It was transformed into a museum of industrial design, not only in its exhibits but in its use of superb architectural salvage from Golden Age banks, auto dealerships and other edifices of high capitalism. During our visit we enjoyed the display of objects from the...


More  



Advertised as a design museum, it also includes some interesting art work (paintings and sculpture) in addition to the modern design exhibits up to 1945. I also enjoyed seeing the historical materials dealing with the Titanic. It has a large adjacent museum shop if you are looking for books, toys, magnets, cards, or souvenirs.

Great museum with a little bit for everybody. There is also a cafe. I would re moment this as a great rainy day activity or if you only have a short time in the city. You can easily see it in under one hour.

Two blocks from the crazy part of South Beach is this unusual museum. The building itself is interesting and the collection within is eclectic, although not always in a good way. There's a real lack of focus or point of view about the stuff that is exhibited. What's a London Underground station sign doing there, for instance? It's a rather...


More  



The Wolfsonian is a collection of STUFF from Miami Beach and around the US. The Wolfson family has a long and successful history in Miami, and they've chosen a historical building to house it in. We spent around 2 hours here, and at least 30 minutes in the gift shop. Even if you aren't going into the museum you MUST...


More  



We visited here by accident during an Art Deco walking tour and couldn't wait to return.
Just loved the layout and the exhibits and would visit again on my next visit.

Wonderful museum, fun for all ages, and a great break from the beach when the weather is poor. Not like any other museum -- a quirky and delightful collection.

The Wolfsonian is a unique collection of artifacts that is eclectic and fascinating. I would recommend this museum to anyone but it is especially nice to do on a rainy day.

Although the building is large and outside beautifully built. Inside is very bare. Some displays are interesting i.e safety posters and art deco pieces. We spent a good hour in the museum. Visit it ona rainy morning or afternoon. Shop is full of high quality items for sale.

title: New World Symphony, Miami Beach

It's a great experience. The sound system is amazing, and the camera coverage of the orchestra is thrilling. And the youthful players were inspiring....

If you fear for the future of classical music, be consoled that there exists an academy such as the New World Symphony!

Great night. Will definitely come back for another program

Amazing entertainment for the entire family, what a way to introduce your children and loved ones to fabulous music. Classical music at its best heard under a cloudless sky . Bring your picnic dinner and enjoy an evening of wonder. The fellows are inspiring and amazing musicians. This is a Miami Beach Saturday night attraction not to be missed,.
Thank...


More  



Nice and relaxing place, fantastic sound and amazing screen, next to Lincoln Road, restaurants and cafes . Great experience

The New World Symphony is a first class music acadamy for music students to perfect their music skills with one and two year full scholarships for those students accepted into the program. Patrons pay money to attend the Symphonies but outside on a lawn is the same opportunity to view what is happening inside. The New World Wall-Cast is a...

Attended our first Saturday evening Wallcast of the New World Symphony with a program of Tchaikovsky and Stravinsky! Getting there more than an hour before the concert was a very good idea. Simply put: the best thing about Miami Beach. A beautiful idea which allows young artists to develop their passion and follow their bliss--and we get to witness this. How blessed are we! The venue is stunning as well.

This Frank Gehry masterpiece is a great asset of Miami Beach and should not be missed. The interior is unique and seats guests in quite a setting. Try to see one of the great performances here. title: Miami Beach Botanical Garden, Miami Beach
address: 2000 Convention Center Dr., Miami Beach, FL 33139
review_list:
This is not a large botanical garden, but it's a nice break from the high rises, shops and noise of most of SoBe. Take a few minutes to stroll through the shaded walkways and see some beautiful plants.

This is a cute little oasis in the heart of a bustling big city. I enjoyed the Japanese Garden with its pagodas and adorable red bridge. I've also never seen a Ylang Ylang tree (I love the essential oil of same), so was neat to see! There are several water features throughout the park, and many places to sit and...


More  



This is a small garden area but a quiet oasis. The trees and plants are well signed and some of the plants are huge.
A pretty oriental garden with a lovely bridge too.
Toilet facilities are good and you can get coffees too.
I found it very difficult to find in the city but worth a visit

This is a "pocket-size" Botanical Garden. Don't go expecting something comprehensive like maybe you'd expect to find in the Miami area. It's pleasant enough, but certainly not worth a special trip, although the Holocaust Memorial next door is well worthwhile and quite moving.

This small garden is a lovely oasis of calm and an enjoyable place to come and visit and maybe even feed the fish. Located behind the holocaust memorial the garden has seating areas and a small lake.

Had such a lovely time strolling the garden with my sister.
We needed a getaway from stresses of life, and this little spot melted them away.

This is a beautiful, peaceful place to see and relax. It is a favorite of local brides who take pictures there.

Lovely spot for a walk with your dog or your date. Water features, birds bathing, lots of carp in the fish pond and they love to be fed. It's small. There is a gift shop, but we didn't go in. Walking distance to Holocaust Memorial and, oddly, across the street from the Miami Convention Center. Easy to park on the...


More  



My husband and I walked to the Convention Center to get some information on the area. It was a hot, long walk.
After we got our information we saw this place across the street, kitty-corner. We went through the gates and were pleasantly surprised to find the place was free. There was a fountain and lots of pretty places to...


More  



These gardens are worth the stroll (just across the street from the Miami Beach Convention Center and near the City Hall). Nicely laid paths and clearly labeled trees and plants. The shade and calm are welcome, too, on an otherwise hot and crowded day. The only negative note is that on both our visits (in 2015 and 2016) they have...

title: Peter Lik's Gallery Miami Beach, Miami Beach
review_list:
Nerver seen such treatment of photo art...
Amazing place and would like to buy the all collection......too expensive though....

Peter Lik is an outstanding nature photographer and his gallery is friendly and inviting. If you are in the South Beach area, make sure to visit it. Even if only to enjoy the photos in spectacular colors and to dream of the desirable vacation spots.

We always visit the Peter Lik store on Lincoln as it is an Art Gallery in itself and a pleasure to view for free.

Like a mini art museum except it is all amazing photos by Peter Lik and you can buy them if you win the lottery. We have stopped in here each time we are in town. You could spend 5 minutes in here or 30minutes , depending on how long you stare at his photos. Not a huge space at all...


More  



Peter Lik's gallery is amazing. Anyone that visits South Beach should make the time to stroll down Lincoln Rd to see his works. You will be in awe. So many to view and no matter when you go back you will always find something new to be amazed by.

You could stare at these photos and walk in this gallery for hours and there are little viewing rooms. The sales people are so knowlegable and seem to truly love their jobs.

While on Lincoln Rd amongst all the shops is a quiet calling to stop in to this gallery and admire the talented photography of this artist. Breathtaking landscapes, seascapes with artistic flair. Very impressive.

A welcome distraction on Lincoln Road from the usual cafes and shops. Great landscape photography in a lovely gallery.

His pictures are absolutely gorgeous. The gallery is nicely laid out with enough assistants available to answer any questions and to give you some insight inot various pictures.

We were walking on the Lincoln Road when I saw a nice photo... I entered at the Gallery and a lot of different and colorful photos invaded my brain. Fantastic opportunity to see excellent pictures made by this Australian photographer.

title: 12th Street Beach, Miami Beach
review_list:
If you want to see a beautiful beach with beautiful hotels and people this is the place to visit. Must see

The gay crowd getting more from Miami Beach to Fort Lauderdale, here is the only spot left, where gays get sun tanned before going back on early evening for a drink at the nearby Palace Bar, where you have funny travestie shows on the street terrasse and around the hour. It is very easy going and cosy... no drama queens...


More  



Very popular busy area; lots of young folks here having fun. Many restaurants and the more inexpensive shops. Lots of homeless in parks.

Nice that gays have their own gathering spot on South Beach. There's usually a big rainbow flag flying at the 12th street beach to let you know your in the right neighborhood for watching the beautiful boys in their speedos. Love the 12th Street Beach

This place is great to have a good time with family and friends. A paradise in the middle of the city, Full of atractitions, food and beverages to get easily. The best latin and american restaurants are in Miami Beach, and also places to have fun.

Very popular public beach suitable for all ages. Beautiful white sand and blue water. Tide and rip current can be strong at times. Observe all notices, warnings and recommendations regarding swimming.

Central location....12th Street Beach is just beachside of The Palace. Very wide section of beach.
Go on a Saturday for the drag shows at the Palace...check performance times for best timing... (Brunch includes unlimited mimosas) or kiosks serve food on beach for a few bucks... 12th Street is the middle of South Beach.
The Tides Hotel is next door and...


More  



Really just part of miles of sandy beach at Miami. Lie back, watch the fun and soak up the sun. Plenty of cheeky birds around. Watch kite flying in windy weather and light aircraft advertising.

If you like watching the surfers… I recommend the beach for kids. I found the beach quiet and clean.

I really enjoyed the 12th Street Beach. It was relaxed, and the people were friendly (and beautiful). I didn't feel the need to constantly watch my valuables and people felt comfortable leaving their items and going in the water. The beach was bustling but not overly busy and it was easy to get a spot at lunch that wasn't on...

title: MDPL Art Deco Welcome Center, Miami Beach
review_list:
UNINTERESTED STAFF, not knowing and where tours were going, and whatever to youthe book,,,,,,,Very poor tourism office kind of thing,,,,,,BETTER veruwhere in EUROPE!!! EVEN in PORTUGAL,,,,,,

We visited the welcome center to get the self-guided walking tour, which was very enjoyable. It's a roughly hour or so stroll around SOBE, with a mini-iPod like device and headset, with interesting information. There's also a guided tour every day at 10:30, I believe. The "museum" in the center is very small, but worth a few minutes visit if...


More  



It is a lot of fun to go for one of their free movie nights. There are some nice exhibits of Art Deco objects and a cute gift shop too.

The welcome centre, museum and gift shop are well set up. Staff are ready to help with any information. The museum behind has many photos that describe the area and its history and the gift shop is fun.

A good generalized short history of South Beach Architecture by an enthusiastic guide. If you have the time, and want some history of the 20's through to present, suggest you go. Walking shoes required.

Paul, our tour guide gave us the history of the Art Deco period at the very beginning so that we would understand what we were looking at. The tour was very interesting and informative, moved at a comfortable pace, and covered the various types of architecture. Our guide was very well informed and gave an exceptional tour. Don't miss it....


More  



Cool, little shop with posters, books and other curios featuring Miami Beach's Art Deco history and buildings. Check it out.

We went to this place for our info on buses and how to get to places,very informative staff and lots of phamphlets

I know it was during the festival, but the people in the Welcome center did not seem friendly. We got a pointed "May I help you?" Apparently my husband's water bottle offended. My question as to the location of bathrooms was answered tersely.
No seating excepts for the ""Don't sit on" exhibits

Took the self guided audio tour that originates in the Art Deco welcome center. More information on architecture than local history and fun facts. Felt like I could have pulled info off of the Internet, taken my own tour and saved 20 bucks.

title: Art Basel, Miami Beach
address: 1901 Convention Center Drive, Miami Beach Convention Center, Miami Beach, FL 33139
review_list:
For collectors, art dealers and plain art lovers, this is the most comprehensive art show I dare to say in America. You will see the cream of the crop gallerists with invaluable art as well as start-up outfits from every corner of the world. It is also a scene dominated by the Latin America well to do.

It's certainly the most visited contemporary art fair in the world... if I understood well, they had 700.000 abroad visitors in 2015... so, you should like stress, loads of people, and battles to see and follow all the events, who have their main concentration on South Beach, but are spread all over the city up to the Wynwood Walls or...


More  



The fair takes thousands of people to the city. So be aware that in early December, the traffic jams are common.
Dinners has to be reserved in good quality restaurants.
Taxi are full. Hotel are more expensive.
So, unless you like art, buy art, or see crowds, don't go. See the organizers website to see the dates.
The fair is...


More  



The vernissage is like Black Friday at Walmart for millionaires. There are ancilliary events all around Miami Beach and Miami. A must=see for anyone interested in fine arts.

There's nothing in the world like Art Basel. The main event at the Miami Beach Convention Center showcases the world's most interesting--and often most expensive--art for sale. The people who attend are themselves, often, works of art, showing fashion that couldn't be imagined in most places, much less actually worn. Most of the art on sale is so expensive that...


More  



People from all over the world gather here on Miami Beach to attend, exhibit, purchase, and network within the Art community. A must see event!

fun, huge space with lots of old and new art. Go early because it get very crowded. Cost of entry 30$. Good food too.

This is a bit like Woodstock for the Art Collector Crowd--a huge exhibition surrounded by many satellite exhibitions focused primarily on modern art-but plenty of other genres are also demonstrated. Prices are astronomical, plenty of rich and famous from all over the world to gawk out--makes it a fun day.
As an aside, there are some interesting food stalls around...


More  



Cascades of artwork in a myriad of venues attended by international crowds over a long weekend is sure to thrill and exhaust attendees. And there is the sideshow of oogling fellow participants. Most work is for sale and photographing the event and the work is encouraged so Art Basel is a holiday for camera buffs. Paintings and sculptures are contemporary...


More  



amazing art- a must see experience. better to go on sunday thought cos most of the other days are for professionals

title: Flamingo Park, Miami Beach
address: 999, 11th Street and Michigan Avenue, South Beach, Miami Beach, FL 33139
review_list:
Use this as part of our vacation workout areas. Lovely setting. Wish I had it near me in nyc. Great walking and running, pool, tennis, Lush trees In a cute residential neighborhood. Very inviting.

Lots of fun activity choices from basketball, tennis, baseball/softball and plenty of open space for football or soccer or just to hang. Plenty of benches and great people watching.

Tnis is a nice city park with a great pool and tennis courts. There is a charge to use the use the pool if you are a non resident.

Well run, clean and safe park with a nice water feature for the kiddies. This park is great year round.

Well groomed, conveniently located, Flamingo Park is a great place to play tennis on the hard-tru courts; they have tennis clinics daily for $25 pp for 1 1/2 hour session. Very nice locker room, tennis clothes and shoes for sale on site. The pool is good for lap swimming. Nice place to walk around.

Tropical with all kinds of trees, in fact it has shaded areas. The main theme is activities. The high light is the pool, which is under repair for the next month. For the kids you still have a fenced in area with climbing walls, and jungle gyms. There is a dog park. The Tennis courts and Basketball courts are very...


More  



Everything about Flamingo Park is excellent... good staff, great facilities, safe and well lit... tennis, running track, dog parks, children's park... BUT the pool is closed indefinitely as of mid-January for repairs and we are told that the repairs may take 2-3 months. The next closest pool is Normandy pool about 30 minutes north of Flamingo. However once the pool...


More  



I love going there once in a while and see basketball games. Also they have other games and activities too. I wish the park was bigger though.

During our recent vacation, my wife and I took our children to the park frequently. Our daughters, age 4.5 and 2.5, enjoyed the great variety of attractions in a fenced in location. The grounds contain both soft surfaces and grass. There are jungle gyms, climbing walls, and other attractions at a children's playground. The other parents at the park included...


More  



After lunch on Lincoln Road we took our little ones to the park to run off their energy. It's a lovely shaded park and the youngest had a great nap. The pool is beautiful and is available for a fee. There are tennis courts as well. something for every one.I t's all very well maintained.

title: Fisher Island, Miami Beach
address: 1 Fisher Island Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33109
review_list:
You need to own or be invited to this barrier island. The houses and condo's are very expensive. If invited, its a 10 minute ferry ride from Miami; Of course you can use your helicopter or boat. The island is upscale for the rich and famous, they have tennis, a couple of restaurants, luxurious spa. Nothing is inexpensive.

This place is great to have a good time with family and friends. A paradise in the middle of the city, Full of story and luxury. For people who never have traveled to Miami before, it's an amazing experience, because there you can see how rich people live. It´s an interesting cruise.

We have the good fortune (no pun intended) to have friends who live on this island for the uber rich and famous. The ferry shuttle assures the residents that only those who are invited get to visit, and it's a very cool few minutes as you traverse the Miami cruise ship channel. It's really a treat to be there--outstanding tennis...


More  



BIG dollar houses with BIG dollar people living in them.
Two ways to get there.
Helicopter and ferry.

Fisher Island seems to be a private island for the rich. No wonder houses are pretty nice and look luxurious.

It's a self contained, BORING reservoir for anorexic super rich people with mostly pink tans. Why bother?
First, you need an invitation.
Second, there are tons of cooler and smarter ways to enjoy frivolity in Miami. The beach is mediocre, food is mediocre and everything is ridiculously overpriced. The only nice thing are the people who work there.
Not worth...


More  



I went to Fisher island because I was invited for dinner at a friend who as a condo there. You need to have your name on the guards' list at the Ferry entrance to get on the boat, and an ID. There is no other way to get there.
The ride only lasts 10 minutes. It is king of cool....


More  



I visited a few clients and friends on fisher island and I find it a bit annoying to take the ferry in and out considering there really isn't much to do there apart from a mediocre spa and a few restaurants...

Only accessible by private boat or ferry, this barrier island is a wonder to behold! Simply beautiful and the homes are amazing~

private island for the super rich, I have been on a few occasions, you must go by ferry and invitation comes by every 30 mins (imagine forgetting something when your home from shopping) the island itself is amazing and first class all the way, Its like living in a 5 star resort 24/7, however the mosquitoes population outnumbers residents in...

title: World Erotic Art Museum (WEAM), Miami Beach
review_list:
I had this place on my list to visit while in South Beach. I must say that I wasn't disappointed. The art displayed in this museum was wonderful and represented all walks of life. I was intrigued, impressed and inspired by all the pieces. Had a ball exploring. Will definitely go again!

It is worth a visit especially if the weather isn't great. It has quite an eclectic array of things to see and the people who are on the reception are very pleasant. Amazing that a grandmother was the collector!

This really is a remarkable collection of erotic and nude art. Some of it is prurient and pretty much porn, some has genuine artistic merit, and much is just kitsch. But it's all fun to look at presuming that you are okay with erotica and can appreciate the full spectrum of sexuall/nudity themed material on display.
There is a lot...


More  



I liked the art. It was interesting to walk around this place and just pick out favorites. It also gave me my own ideas. I had a good time.

This was a fun little stop on our vacation. Definitely only suggest this place for mature adults. It is exactly what it sounds like, but done in a tasteful setting. I believe tickets were $15 each. It took us about an hour to go through the museum.

We had an hour of fun, with many differentiated perspectives on one of the most popular topics ever.....and forever.

We were made aware of this museum on our tour and thought it might be a bit 'smutty' but it was nothing of the sort. It was in fact quite amazing to see the range of erotic art that had been accumulated .The art works ranged from all over the world and so many different cultures. The exhibits were made...


More  



This museum was totally fascinating. The large collection of art from all over the world and from all periods of years was very interesting.

Miami has quite a broad art scene, and WEAM is no exception. The exhibit designs are fairly home-spun but the amount of work in the collection is pretty impressive, ranging from an anatomically correct Homer Simpson doll to beautiful French magazine plates to a set piece from A Clockwork Orange. It's a bit like exploring your naughty grandma's attic.

Looked good on the out side but poor exposition on the inside. few pic's and sculptures you seen before.

title: Art Deco Walks with Marty and Paula - Tours, Miami Beach
review_list:
My husband and I really enjoyed this walking tour of the Art Deco district in South Beach. Marty is well acquainted with the area and there was not a question we asked that he couldn't answer. This is only a 90 minute experience and you do not need to be in good physical walking condition to enjoy it.

Me, my husband and a friend went on Paula's Wynwood art walk after taking her Art Deco tour and really enjoying it. The tour was great, Paula is very knowledgeable and gave us a lot of information about individual pieces and the artists involved, as well as the area itself. She also took us to some of her favourite galleries....


More  



Went on a Wednesday afternoon with a few friends. Paula was informative, interesting, and very engaging. Learned a lot about the history of the Miami Beach as well as the Art Deco district. Especially loved the added pictures she shared with us. Will definitely take another Miami tour with Marty and Paula!!

Our group of 8 spent a couple of rain-soaked hours walking the art deco district of Miami Beach with Paula on February 28, 2016. The rain didn't dampen Paula's enthusiasm for her topic; she simply adjusted to the downpour and filled our valuable time with detailed information about the history, architecture, art, and fascinating people of Miami Beach. She was...


More  



We took a 10 am walking tour with Marty in Jan. He explained and reinforced ideas as we walked. Marty is a great educator and I left understanding Art Deco more than ever before. I also like the fact that he greeted so many peopled in the community as we walked... I felt we were with a friend giving us...


More  



We found the Art Deco preservation projects walk, with Paula to be thoroughly worthwhile. Paula is a great raconteur, and has a fount of useful, informative information which she delivers with great style. We learnt about ziggurats and eyebrows, and so much more about the Art Deco style, together with the modern methods of moving forwards with design etc. She...


More  



This tour is a great activity for couples or families. Marty is an informative and entertaining tour guide. We learned a lot about architecture and covered a lot of ground on South Beach. A great way to spend the afternoon!

My husband and I took this 2 hour tour on a recent trip to South Beach. Neither one of us were familiar with the area so we found the info that Paula provided informative as well as entertaining. I had a whole new perspective of the shops on Lincoln Road after the tour. We learned the history of South Beach,...


More  



Paula gave us a clear and informative history of the development of Miami South Beach, Florida and of its art deco architecture. Enjoyable walk and interesting insights into the area without too much information overload.

We have an enjoyable time with Marty- he was very knowledgeable about art deco and was able to quickly hone our eyes to the specifities of the style. We also appreciated his research into our hometown so that we could better recognize the effects the art deco movement had in other parts of the country.

James...
